page.title: 17DEVORAN PLAYING FIELD
page.content: The playing field at Devoran was pre- sented to the village by the Agar- Robartes family from Lanhydrock. It was given after the First World War in memory of those from the vill- age who died during the war. It used to have bamboos and shrubs, also two concrete seats,but one became overgrown with brambles. It was very difficult to play football because the field sloped so badly. It was not improved because it would cost too much, but now the Manpower Services are doing the work and the village just has to pay for the mater- ials and the use of the diggers and other machinery. Work began on levelling the field in February 1985. The school is contributing to the cost because it uses the field most.
